programme.title: Flight

programme.desc: Omar and Naomi have an intense discussion about organized religion; Keith is nervous when he has to meet Lil' Day Day to collect payment; Greg and Wanda have a rendezvous at a local bar; Jarvis and Lisa's conflict comes to a breaking point.

programme.desc: Omar and Eugene take Caleb on a trip to the great outdoors; Keith takes photographs of Jackee for her birthday; Jarvis pays Danni a secret visit at a motel.

programme.title: Johnson
programme.desc: Keith doesn't approve of his mom beginning to date again; Greg embarrasses Wanda at Omar's housewarming party; Jarvis finally finds out who is responsible for harassing him and Danni.

programme.title: Johnson
programme.desc: Things don't go as planned when Keith takes Jackee on a date for her birthday; Omar gets some unexpected news from a past acquaintance and Jarvis confronts Kevin about his true ulterior motives.

programme.desc: Omar, Greg, Keith and Jarvis reminisce about their childhood and give Omar advice on his marriage troubles; Greg returns the favor and helps LaQuisha by fixing her home heating system; Jarvis is confronted by Lisa for his close friendship with Danni.

programme.desc: Omar finally attends church and gives a powerful testimony that shocks everyone; Keith vulnerably professes his feelings for Jackee through poetry; Jarvis learns some truths that changes everything he thought he knew about his family history.

programme.desc: Omar learns some shocking information about Bianca; Greg gets out-hustled by an unwanted house guest; Keith notices his neighborhood is changing and blames his local councilman; Jarvis visits the man who claims to be his father.

programme.desc: When Bryanna brings home a stray dog, the children hide it until Christmas Day, figuring Bernie will allow them to keep it.

programme.desc: Jordan goes out for football in hopes of winning a trophy for the Bernie Mac Hall of Fame awards shelf. Former Oakland Raiders running back Marcus Allen, MVP of Super Bowl XVIII, guest stars.

programme.desc: Bernie's weeklong stint on a local radio show leaves his family upset when he uses his private life to get laughs.

programme.desc: When heartburn sends him to the emergency room, Bernie resolves to beat his age by acting like he did in his youth.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show
programme.desc: Bernie becomes a stern taskmaster after witnessing the children's behavior at dinner, cracking down on Vanessa for her grades and making Bryana speak Spanish all the time.

programme.title: The Bernie Mac Show
programme.desc: After hearing it from Bernie at home, Bryana repeats inappropriate language at school, prompting a social worker to visit the house to discuss Bernie's hostility problems.
